an1.258-267:1.1: “The foremost of my laywomen in first going for refuge is Sujātā Seniyadhītā.
an1.258-267:2.1: … as a donor is Visākhā, Migāra’s mother.
an1.258-267:3.1: … who are very learned is Khujjuttarā.
an1.258-267:4.1: … who dwell in love is Sāmāvatī.
an1.258-267:6.1: … who give fine things is Suppavāsā Koliyadhītā.
an1.258-267:7.1: … who care for the sick is the laywoman Suppiyā.
an1.258-267:8.1: … who have experiential confidence is Kātiyānī.
an1.258-267:9.1: … who are intimate is the householder Nakula’s mother.
an1.258-267:10.1: … whose confidence is based on oral transmission is the laywoman Kāḷī of Kuraraghara.”
